steps.description: Customer completes an online personal loan eligibility check using Barclays's affordability and credit pre-assessment engine.
steps.businessRationale: Eligibility checks in retail banking typically take 2–4 minutes due to credit bureau lookups and affordability calculations. Faster responses reduce abandonment and increase loan funnel throughput.

steps.description: Customer begins the full personal loan application, providing identity, employment, and financial details.
steps.businessRationale: Loan applications in UK banking average 5–7 minutes. Reducing friction here directly improves conversion and reduces call-centre escalations.

steps.description: Barclays runs automated credit scoring, affordability modelling, and risk checks to determine loan approval.
steps.businessRationale: Automated credit decisioning typically takes 3–5 minutes depending on bureau response times. Delays here directly reduce approval conversion and increase drop-off.

steps.description: Customer is shown personalised loan terms including APR, monthly repayment, and total cost of credit.
steps.businessRationale: Offer presentation is a short step but critical for conversion. Clear, fast presentation increases acceptance likelihood.

steps.description: Customer accepts the loan offer and Barclays initiates funds release to the customer’s account.
steps.businessRationale: Funds disbursement includes compliance checks and internal ledger updates. UK banks typically complete this in 5–10 minutes.

steps.description: Customer schedules their first repayment and Barclays sets up the Direct Debit mandate.
steps.businessRationale: Direct Debit setup typically takes 3–5 minutes. Ensuring accuracy here reduces failed payments and improves long-term loan performance.
